content:
Next up, PR #3757 by @Thomas Murrills has been out for reviews for quite some time now.

In one file (Compare.lean), it adds a highly configurable way to compare two goal states and everything they include (expressions, mvars, etc.), which allows to pick the level of difference that should be ignored when comparing. Then it uses this comparison to redefine fail_if_no_progress.

The highly detailed docstrings (and the lists of config options) make out a big part of this PR, so it should be less to review than it might seem.
